Description: THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE CITY OF LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA TO CLEAN UP A BROWNFIELD SITE AT RIVER PARK, LOCATED AT 2850 KERR STREET, LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA. ENCOMPASSING 12.5 ACRES WITHIN A 42-ACRE FORMER RAILYARD PROPERTY, THE SITE LIES ALONG THE LOS ANGELES RIVER AND IS WITHIN A QUALIFIED OPPORTUNITY ZONE. THE SITE IS CONTAMINATED WITH METALS, ARSENIC, AND VOLATILE AND SEMI-VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS CO-MINGLED WITH PETROLEUM HYDROCARBONS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000.00.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF EUREKA TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN A FORMER RAILYARD AREA KNOWN AS THE BALLOON TRACK AND THE SURROUNDING WATERFRONT AREA ADJACENT TO HUMBOLDT BAY. THE CITY WILL ASSESS AND PLAN FOR THE REDEVELOPMENT IN STRATEGIC AREAS THROUGHOUT THE TARGET AREA.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $300,000.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR NORTHERN ARIZONA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR IN ARIZONA. COALITION MEMBERS ENVISION THE FOLLOWING REDEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES: 1) PROMOTION OF HISTORIC AND CULTURAL TOURISM OPPORTUNITIES, ESPECIALLY WITH REGARD TO ROUTE 66, RAILROADS, AND UNIQUE NATURAL AND SCENIC RESOURCES; 2) ECONOMIC DIVERSIFICATION TO BROADEN EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN EXISTING AND EMERGING INDUSTRY SECTORS, INCLUDING FOREST RESTORATION AND BIOMASS ENERGY PRODUCTION; AND, 3) REHABILITATION AND/OR CONSTRUCTION OF LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME AND WORKFORCE HOUSING.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $597,686.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE WESTERN NEVADA DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT (WNDD) TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE CITY OF LOVELOCK AND PORTIONS OF PERSHING COUNTY, NEVADA. SPECIFICALLY, WNDD WILL FOCUS ASSESSMENT WORK ON FOUR TARGET AREAS, INCLUDING COMMUNITY GATEWAYS, INDUSTRIAL PARK, DOWNTOWN CORRIDOR AND MINE SCARRED AREAS. WNDD'S GOAL IS TO SUPPORT ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION BY FREEING UP KEY LANDS THAT ARE ALREADY ZONED FOR DEVELOPMENT AND REDUCE SPRAWL BY INFILLING VACANT LOTS WITHIN THE CITY'S LIMITS.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $600,000.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 7/1/2019.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR COCHISE COUNTY TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN COCHISE COUNTY, ARIZONA. THE COUNTY AND ITS COALITION PARTNERS (THE CITIES OF BISBEE, DOUGLAS, AND SIERRA VISTA) WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDS TO FURTHER BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT AND REDEVELOPMENT THROUGHOUT THE TARGETED COMMUNITIES.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $600,000.

THE CITY OF FRESNO FORMED A BROWNFIELDS COALITION WITH FRESNO COUNTY, SAINTS REST COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AND THE CHINATOWN FRESNO FOUNDATION TO ASSESS AND PLAN FOR THE REDEVELOPMENT IN STRATEGIC AREAS THROUGHOUT THE TARGET AREA. THE SITE LIES ALONG SALMON HARBOR OF THE SMITH RIVER, THE PACIFIC OCEAN, AND CA HIGHWAY 101. SEVERAL SITES WITHIN XVR HAVE SOIL AND BUILDINGS THAT ARE CONTAMINATED WITH LEAD, ASBESTOS AND CADMIUM. THE COCHISE COUNTY RLF PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE ECONOMIC BENEFITS THAT CAN ARISE FROM SUSTAINABLE PROJECTS. BY PROVIDING LOW-INTEREST LOANS, THE RLF AIMS TO STIMULATE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND JOB CREATION WITHIN COCHISE COUNTY.
OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 2-3 LOANS AND 1-2 SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE MULTIPLE BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING MULTIPLE COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING ONE OR MORE ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING TEN OR MORE QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR COCHISE COUNTY, ARIZONA.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE CITY OF FRESNO, CALIFORNIA TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(5)(A)(II) IN THE CITY OF FRESNO, CALIFORNIA.ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE SUPPLEMENTAL RFL IS TO CONTINUE TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES FOR SEVERAL CITY DEPARTMENTS AND PRIVATE DEVELOPERS THROUGHOUT THE CITY OF FRESNO. THE LOANS WILL BE AVAILABLE CITYWIDE AND USED AS A FUNDING TOOL FOR MULTIPLE CITY DEPARTMENTS. THE CITY'S PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE CODE ENFORCEMENT DEPARTMENT TO ADMINISTER LOANS ON CONTAMINATED SITES AND WITH THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT AS A RESOURCE FOR POTENTIAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS. THE STRATEGY WILL BE TO USE THE CITY'S EXISTING EPA BROWNFIELDS COMMUNITYWIDE ASSESSMENT GRANT TO ELIMINATE UNCERTAINTIES (OVER REGULATED BUILDING MATERIALS ABATEMENT COSTS, MARKET DEMAND, ETC.) THAT ARE IMPEDING DEVELOPERS FROM SECURING FUNDING TO MOVE FORWARD WITH REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF HIGH-OPPORTUNITY SITES, AND THEN TO HAVE RLF FUNDING AVAILABLE TO HELP FUND THE SOMETIMES DIFFICULT TO FINANCE INITIAL ABATEMENT AND CLEANUP WORK.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 1-4+ LOANS AND 1-2 SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE 2-6+ BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING 10 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING MULTIPLE ANALYSES OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE CITY OF FRESNO, CALIFORNIA.

ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT TO BE FUNDED BY THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AND MAKE LOANS AND SUBAWARDS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES FOR CLEANUP OF SITES TO FACILITATE THE PROPERTIES' REDEVELOPMENT. THESE GOALS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY SITE-SPECIFIC AND NON-SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES. NON-SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE MARKETING THE PROGRAM TO CITIES, TRIBES, AND DEVELOPERS, AND CONDUCTING PUBLIC OUTREACH AND PREPARING OUTREACH MATERIALS RELEVANT TO THE RLF PROGRAM. SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE VERIFYING SITE AND BORROWER/SUBAWARD RECIPIENT ELIGIBILITY, PREPARING LOAN DOCUMENTS, PREPARING QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS (QAPP), CONDUCTING SITE-SPECIFIC PUBLIC RELATIONS ACTIVITIES, PREPARING ANALYSES OF BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES (ABCA), AND CONSULTING WITH, AND ENROLLING SITES IN, THE STATE VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM (VCP).  OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY UP TO 50% OF ITS FUNDING IN LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE MULTIPLE BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING A MINIMUM OF 2 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING MULTIPLE ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 12 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR HUMBOLDT COUNTY, CALIFORNIA.

ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE, AS NEEDED, AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE PROJECT GOALS BY: 1) ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING A COMPREHENSIVE BROWNFIELD INVENTORY; 2) CONDUCTING PHASE I AND II ESAS TO FACILITATE THE CLEANUP, TRANSFER, AND REDEVELOPMENT OF BROWNFIELDS;  3) ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY AND STAKEHOLDERS IN IDENTIFYING AND PRIORITIZING SITES AND REDEVELOPMENT PLANNING; AND, 4) CONDUCTING AREA WIDE PLANNING WITHIN ONE FOCUS AREA (THE BAKER STREET CORRIDOR) INCLUDING MARKET ANALYSIS, EXISTING CONDITIONS/INFRASTRUCTURE EVALUATION STUDIES, SITE-SPECIFIC REUSE PLANNING FOR CATALYST BROWNFIELD SITES, AND COMMUNITY VISIONING EXERCISES TO INFORM A COMMON REDEVELOPMENT STRATEGY AND IMPLEMENTATION PLAN. FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING UP TO 12 PHASE I AND UP TO 8 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING REGULAR COMMUNITY MEETINGS WITH THE BROWNFIELDS ADVISORY COMMITTEE, DEVELOPING UP TO 4 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING 1 AREA-WIDE PLANNING DOCUMENT TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING12 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND BROWNFIELDS IN AND NEAR BAKERSFIELD, CALIFORNIA.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT MOVING POTENTIALLY CONTAMINATED INFILL AND OTHER PROPERTIES, WHICH ARE OFTEN MINE-SCARRED LANDS, BACK INTO PRODUCTIVE USE. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 
- DEVELOPMENT OF A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL/REQUEST FOR QUALIFICATIONS (RFP/RFQ) AND/OR OTHER MATERIALS RELATED TO SELECTING A CONTRACTOR (QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL)
- BROWNFIELDS SITE INVENTORY AND ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS
- DEVELOPMENT OF QAPP AND SAPS
- COMPLETION OF PHASE I AND PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS
- DEVELOPMENT OF CLEANUP AND REUSE PLANS
- COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT
- REGULAR REPORTING
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LONGER TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE REDEVELOPMENT OF CONTAMINATED INFILL PROPERTIES TO SUPPORT ADDITIONAL HOUSING AND/OR JOB CREATION OPPORTUNITIES THAT ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE CITY'S GENERAL PLAN DESIGNATIONS FOR EACH PROPERTY. OTHER DELIVERABLES AND GOALS INCLUDE:
- CONTINUE TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON THE ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH LEGACY MINING THAT BOTH HINDER DEVELOPMENT OF LANDS PLANNED FOR REDEVELOPMENT AND CREATE POTENTIAL SAFETY CONCERNS.
- HELP REDUCE THE FINANCIAL UNCERTAINTY OF THE CLEANUP COSTS AND STIMULATE REDEVELOPMENT OR DEVELOPMENT OF THESE CONTAMINATED LANDS.  
- OBTAIN CA DTSC REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF FOUR OR FIVE CLEANUP PLANS (RAWS).
- COMPLETE STRATEGIC PLANNING TO MITIGATE HAZARDS AND REUSE LAND FOR POSSIBLE RENEWABLE ENERGY PRODUCTION AND PUBLIC USE. 
- ONCE THE CA DTSC APPROVES THE CLEANUP PLANS, THE CITY CAN LEVERAGE PUBLIC FUNDS AND/OR PRIVATE FUNDS FOR INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AND CONSTRUCTION OF HOUSING AND NON-RESIDENTIAL DEVELOPMENT, AND FOR RECREATIONAL, RENEWABLE ENERGY DEVELOPMENT, AND POSSIBLY SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL USES.   
- ABILITY TO BETTER PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT AND REDEVELOPMENT OF INFILL PARCELS WHICH HELPS REDUCE URBAN SPRAWL, COMMUTE LENGTHS, ENERGY CONSUMPTION, AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. 
- COMPLETE AT LEAST TWO PHASE I AND FIVE PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS.

DESCRIPTION:CITY OF TUCSON'S REVOLVING LOAN FUND (RLF) ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE CLEANUP ASSISTANCE WITHIN THE CITY OF TUCSON'S CITY LIMITS, WITH PARTICULAR ATTENTION ON FOUR HIGH-PRIORITY, FOCUS AREAS: LA DOCE; THRIVE IN THE 05; BARRIO CENTRO/JULIA KEEN NEIGHBORHOOD; AND DOWNTOWN TUCSON/HISTORIC BARRIOS. THE MAJORITY OF THE GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR CLEANUP LOANS AND SUBGRANTS. 

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,000,000. REFER TO TERMS AND CONDITIONS.ACTIVITIES:TUCSON'S REVOLVING LOAN FUND (RLF) WILL PROVIDE CLEANUP ASSISTANCE LOANS AND SUBAWARDS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEVELOPING THE LOAN PROGRAM, MARKETING THE PROGRAM, ACTIVELY MANAGING THE PROGRAM, OBTAINING CONTRACTOR SERVICES INCLUDING A FISCAL AGENT, CONDUCTING PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND PREPARING OUTREACH MATERIALS RELEVANT TO THE RLF PROGRAM. SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE VERIFYING SITE AND BORROWER/SUBAWARD RECIPIENT ELIGIBILITY, PREPARING LOAN DOCUMENTS, PREPARING EPA SITE ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATION AND QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS (QAPPS), CONDUCTING SITE-SPECIFIC PUBLIC RELATIONS ACTIVITIES, PREPARING ANALYSES OF BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES (ABCA) REPORTS, AND CONSULTING WITH AND ENROLLING SITES IN THE ADEQ VOLUNTARY REMEDIATION PROGRAM (VRP). SUBRECIPIENT:THE PURPOSE OF THE EPA BROWNFIELDS RLF ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS FOR THE RECIPIENT TO PROVIDE BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP FUNDING VIA LOANS OR SUBAWARDS. SUBAWARDS WILL FUND THE CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS PROPERTIES.OUTCOMES:PROJECT DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  
- QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS
- QUARTERLY ACRES UPDATES
- RLF CLOSEOUT AGREEMENT
- LOAN AND SUBGRANT AGREEMENTS/DOCUMENTS
- COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN
- OUTREACH MATERIALS
- SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS PLANS
- INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN THE COMMUNITY, ESPECIALLY IN THE FOCUS AREAS, FOR IMPROVED COMMUNITY HEALTH, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, INCREASED HOME OWNERSHIP, EQUITABLE GROWTH, JOB CREATION, IMPROVED ACCESS TO LOCAL FOODS, EASIER ACCESS TO AFFORDABLE TRANSIT, AND REDEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR UNDERUTILIZED PROPERTIES AS A RESULT OF CLEANUP EFFORTS PERFORMED THROUGH ISSUED LOANS AND SUBGRANTS.

DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR CITY OF KANSAS CITY, MISSOURI AND ITS COALITION PARTNERS (JACKSON COUNTY, MISSOURI AND THE UNIFIED GOVERNMENT OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY/KANSAS CITY, KANSAS) TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND (RLF) AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(5)(A)(II) IN KANSAS CITY AND JACKSON COUNTY, MISSOURI, AND WYANDOTTE COUNTY, KANSAS.ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE MADE IN THE FORM OF LOANS OR SUBGRANTS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES CERCLA   104(K)(1), WHICH INCLUDES CERTAIN NONPROFITS, TO FUND CLEANUP AND RELATED COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES AT ELIGIBLE BROWNFIELDS WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE KANSAS CITY REGIONAL BROWNFIELDS COALITION REVOLVING LOAN FUND PROGRAM WHICH INCLUDE THE KANSAS CITY AND JACKSON COUNTY, MISSOURI AND WYANDOTTE COUNTY, KANSAS.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY TWO LOANS OR SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE TWO BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING TWO COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING TWO ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR KANSAS CITY AND JACKSON COUNTY, MISSOURI AND WYANDOTTE COUNTY, KANSAS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) FOR SALT LAKE COUNTY TO CONDUCT ELIGIBLE ASSESSMENT-RELATED ACTIVITIES AS AUTHORIZED BY CERLCA 104(K)(2) IN SALT LAKE COUNTY, UTAH.  
ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES.  ALSO, THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SALT LAKE COUNTY, MAGNA, AND NEIGHBORWORKS SALT LAKE (THE 'COALITION') ARE PLANNING TO TARGET AT LEAST THREE BROWNFIELD PRIORITY AREAS WITHIN SALT LAKE COUNTY TO CREATE A CLEANER, HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT AND REVITALIZE LAND WHILE PREVENTING FURTHER CONTAMINATION. THE COALITION SEEKS TO ASSESS PROPERTIES WITHIN THOSE TARGET AREAS THAT HAVE A HIGH LIKELIHOOD OF REDEVELOPMENT WITHIN THE GRANT PERIOD AND TO FOCUS ON PROPERTIES THAT COULD UTILIZE THE BROWNFIELDS REVOLVING LOAN FUND ADMINISTERED BY SALT LAKE COUNTY IN ORDER TO FURTHER INCENTIVIZE REDEVELOPMENT. FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING 10-18 PHASE I AND PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING 3-6 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOPING 3-6 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING 1-2 PLANNING DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING QUARTERLY REPORTS FOR EACH YEAR OF THE PROJECT PERIOD LENGTH UNTIL CLOSEOUT. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR SALT LAKE COUNTY, UTAH.

ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE GFDA TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. THE GFDA WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:THE RECIPIENT PROPOSES TO USE TO PROVIDE $848,000 OF SUBGRANTS TO ELIGIBLE ENITITES FOR THE CLEAN UP OF CONTAMINATED SITES. OUTCOMES:GFDA WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 2 LOANS, 2 SUBGRANTS, 1 LOAN/SUBRANT COMBINATION TO REMEDIATE 5 BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ADDITIONALLY THE RECIPIENT HAS IDENTIFED AN ADDTIONAL 8 POTENTIAL CLEANUP PROJECTS FOR A TOTAL OF 13 BROWNFIELDS SITES. THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES HOLDING A COMMUNITY MEETING FOR EVERY LOAN/SUBGRANT PROJECT (POTENTIALLY 13), FINALIZING AN ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES FOR EVERY LOAN AND SUBGRANT (POTENTIALLY 13), AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS IN THE FIVE YEAR GRANT PERIOD. DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CENTRAL VIRGINIA PLANNING DISTRICT COMMISSION TO CONDUCT ELIGIBLE ASSESSMENT-RELATED ACTIVITIES AS AUTHORIZED BY COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT 104(K)(2) IN LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES IN AND AROUND THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED, JAMES RIVER, THE ROANOKE WATERSHED INCLUDING BROOKNEAL, THE TOWN AND COUNTY OF APPOMATTOX AND THE CENSUS AREA OF MADISON HEIGHTS. BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL ASSESS AND PLAN FOR THE REUSE OF AN OLD INDUSTRIAL FURNITURE PLANT AND A FORMER TEXTILE PLANT, CONFEDERATE AVENUE IN DOWNTOWN APPOMATTOX, AND ROUTE 29 AT THE ENTRANCE CORRIDOR OF MADISON HEIGHTS.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES.  ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING 14 PHASE I AND 6 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING 18 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOPING 4 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING 2 PLANNING DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING 12 QUARTERLY REPORTS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN IN LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES IN AND AROUND THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED, JAMES RIVER, THE ROANOKE WATERSHED INCLUDING BROOKNEAL, THE TOWN AND COUNTY OF APPOMATTOX, AND THE CENSUS AREA OF MADISON HEIGHTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (ALSO KNOWN AS THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT; PUBLIC LAW 117-58) FOR THE REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY OF THE COUNTY OF MONTGOMERY, PENNSYLVANIA, TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND (RLF) AS AUTHORIZED BY COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT 104(K)(5)(A)(II) IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA.  BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF.  ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED.  THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SUBGRANT ACTIVITIES WILL CONSIST OF SITE-SPECIFIC REMEDIATION AND REMEDIATION MONITORING.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 2-4 LOANS AND 2 SUB-GRANTS TO REMEDIATE 4-6 BROWNFIELD SITES, AND ANTICIPATES HOLDING COMMUNITY MEETINGS AS NEEDED, FINALIZING 5 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS.  WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR MONTGOMERY COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE STATE OF VIRGINIA. THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL FOCUS ON THIS REGION AS THE INITIAL TARGET AREA IN A STATEWIDE PROJECT TO IDENTIFY, ASSESS, PLAN, AND FACILITATE THE TRANSFORMATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES INTO RENEWABLE ENERGY AND CLEAN INDUSTRY DEVELOPMENTS. THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT THE 80,000 RESIDENTS OF BRUNSWICK, HALIFAX, AND MECKLENBURG COUNTIES IN VIRGINIAS SOUTHSIDE PLANNING DISTRICT COMMISSION REGION. THE TARGET AREAS JP STEVENS PLANT (HALIFAX), BURLINGTON CLARKSVILLE PLANT (MECKLENBURG), AND BRUNSWICK CORRECTIONAL FACILITY (BRUNSWICK) WERE CHOSEN BASED ON THEIR POTENTIAL FOR REDEVELOPMENT TO SUPPORT RENEWABLE ENERGY AND THEIR IMPACT ON SURROUNDING PROPERTIES AND NEIGHBORHOODS. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTPUTS INCLUDE THE REDEVELOPMENT OF THE PRIORITY PROPERTIES THAT WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO SIGNIFICANTLY ATTRACT PUBLIC AND PRIVATE INVESTMENT, CREATE JOBS, HELP OUR TRANSITION TO CLEAN ENERGY, AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF THE TARGET AREA COMMUNITIES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO BLUEFIELD ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY (BLUEFIELD EDA) TO CLEAN UP A BROWNFIELD SITE LOCATED IN THE 300-400 BLOCK OF FEDERAL STREET IN DOWNTOWN BLUEFIELD, WEST VIRGINIA. THE BROWNFIELD SITE CONSISTS OF SEVEN ADJACENT BUILDINGS LOCATED IN THE 300-400 BLOCK OF FEDERAL STREET IN DOWNTOWN BLUEFIELD. THE SITE ENCOMPASSES AN APPROXIMATELY 0.99-ACRE AREA IMPROVED WITH A PARK (CHICORY SQUARE), AND SEVEN BUILDINGS, WHICH ARE PART OF BLUEFIELD&RSQUOANDS DOWNTOWN COMMERCIAL HISTORIC DISTRICT. THIS FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, CLEANUP PLANNING, AND SITE CLEANUP. HOWEVER, BLUEFIELD ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY WILL USE THE MAJORITY OF THE GRANT FUNDS FOR SITE CLEANUP ACTIVITIES. PROJECT MANAGEMENT OUTPUTS INCLUDE 12 QUARTERLY REPORTS, 3 DISADVANTAGED BUSINESS ENTERPRISE REPORTS, 3 FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORTS, AND 1 FINAL CLEANUP REPORT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF BLUEFIELD, WEST VIRGINIA.

DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR NIAGARA COUNTY TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(5)(A)(II) IN NIAGARA COUNTY, NEW YORK. ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE USED TO REMEDIATE CONTAMINATED SITES IN ORDER TO FACILITATE PROPERTY'S REDEVELOPMENT. OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 5 LOANS AND 12 SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE 17  BROWNFIELD SITES; ANTICIPATES HOLDING SEVERAL COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING 17 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING SEVERAL QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR NIAGARA COUNTY, NEW YORK.

ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED, AND WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE USED TO REMEDIATE CONTAMINATED SITES.OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 2 LOANS AND 2 SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE 4 BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING 10 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING 4 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR CHAUTAUQUA COUNTY, NEW YORK.

THESE TARGETED AREAS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BY THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, FOR THE COMMUNITY-WIDE PHASE I AND PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS IN THE CITY OF DUNKIRK, NEW YORK.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT
EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE CITY OF DUNKIRK ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING 19 PHASE I AND 6 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING 3 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOPING 6 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING 2 PLANNING DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING 12 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND BROWNFIELDS IN AND NEAR THE NYS-DESIGNATED BOA COMMUNITY IN THE CITY OF DUNKIRK, NEW YORK.

ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE MUNICIPALITY OF AGUAS BUENAS COMMUNITY-WIDE GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP AN INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES AND CONDUCT 10 PHASE I AND UP TO NINE PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS AND UP TO NINE QAPP REPORTS.  GRANT FUNDS ALSO WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP UP TO 10 CLEANUP PLANS AND TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. THE MUNICIPALITY WILL ALSO HOLD 6-9 COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT EVENTS.  THE MUNICIPALITY WILL ALSO PREPARE QUARTERLY REPORTS AND ANNUAL FINANCIAL REPORTS.  WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND BROWNFIELD IN AND NEAR THE PR156/174 CORRIDOR, AN URBAN AREA IN THE MUNICIPALITY OF AGUAS BUENAS, PUERTO RICO WHERE MOST COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITY OCCURS. PRIORITY SITES INCLUDE A FORMER SCHOOL, A VACANT GAS STATION, A FORMER ELECTRONIC COMPONENTS MANUFACTURER, AN APARTMENT BUILDING, AND A FORMER PUBLIC HOUSING COMPLEX.

CDPHE WILL PROVIDE SUBGRANTS TO THE CITY OF LONGMONT, AND THE TOWNS OF LYONS, FIRESTONE AND CORTEZ; OTHER TARGET AREAS WITHIN THE JURISDICTION OF CDPHE MAY BE CONSIDERED FOR INCLUSION.  CDPHE WILL SELECT THE QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL CONTRACTOR(S).  THE SUBGRANTS WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PERSONNEL TO CREATE A SITE INVENTORY OF ELIGIBLE BROWNFIELD SITES FOR ASSESSMENT WITHIN THEIR RESPECTIVE MUNICIPAL JURISDICTIONS.  THE MUNICIPALITIES WILL MANAGE THE SITE IDENTIFICATION, SUBMIT ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS, CONDUCT OVERSIGHT AND REVIEW OF QEP ACTIVITIES WITHIN THEIR JURISDICTION, UNDER THE UMBRELLA OVERSIGHT OF CDPHE.  
ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). 

 SUBRECIPIENT:SPECIFICALLY, THIS BROWNFIELDS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY AND ASSESS BROWNFIELD PROPERTIES FOR FUTURE USE AND REDEVELOPMENT. SUBGRANTS TO THE CITY OF LONGMONT AND THE TOWNS OF LYONS, CORTEZ AND FIRESTONE, COLORADO WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO PERSONNEL TO ASSIST THE CDPHE AT A LOCAL LEVEL FOR SITES TO BE ASSESSED THROUGH THE QEP SELECTED BY CDPHE. ADDITIONAL TARGET AREAS WITHIN THE JURISDICTION OF CDPHE MAY BE CONSIDERED FOR INCLUSION. OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING MULTIPLE PHASE I PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS IN THE 3 PRIMARY TARGET AREAS.  ADDITIONAL TARGET AREAS MAY BE CONSIDERED. EXACT NUMBER OF ASSESSMENTS IS NOT KNOWN, BUT WILL BE TRACKED AND REPORTED IN ACRES BY CDPHE. A TOTAL OF 8 SITES IN 3 TARGET AREAS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED, THOUGH  THE NUMBER OF PARCELS (88) MAY RESULT IN SOME SUBDIVISION OF SITES AND RESULTING ASSESSMENTS. TARGET AREA 1 INCLUDES 86 PARCELS AND 286.5 ACRES IN LONGMONT AND LYONS, COLORADO.  TARGET AREA 2 INCLUDES 2 PARCELS IN CORTEZ, COLORADO AND TARGET AREA 3 INCLUDES 4 PARCELS IN FIRESTONE, COLORADO.  SUBGRANTS WILL BE ISSUED TO THESE MUNICIPALITIES FOR PERSONNEL TO PROVIDE EXPERTISE TO IDENTIFY SITES, HOLD COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOP SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOP PLANNING DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION IN COLLABORATION WITH CDPHE AND THE QEP.  SUBGRANTEES WILL REPORT TO CDPHE, THROUGH MEETINGS, PERIODIC REPORTS ON SITE PROGRESS AND RECOMMENDATIONS.  CDPHE WILL TRACK ALL ACTIVITIES AND SUBMIT A MINIMUM OF 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND BROWNFIELD IN AND NEAR LONGMONT, LYONS, CORTEZ AND FIRESTONE, COLORADO; ADDITIONAL TARGET AREAS WITHIN THE STATE ME BE CONSIDERED FOR INCLUSION.

ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR THE SITE, AND REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP, AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES TO BE COMPLETED THROUGH SUBAWARDS INCLUDE: WVDEP SUBAWARD FOR ALL ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY WVDEP PERSONNEL IN IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATE VOLUNTARY REMEDIATION PROGRAM SUCH AS REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF ALL DOCUMENTS SUBMITTED TO WVDEP BY RECIPIENT, SITE VISITS, AND LABORATORY COSTS FOR SPLIT SAMPLES WITH RECIPIENT; A SUBAWARD TO GREEN VALLEY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION TO CONDUCT OVERALL PROJECT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES AND ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS UNDER THE DIRECTION OF THE RECIPIENT.
OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL REMEDIATE THE FORMER HOWE'S LEATHER COMPANY (AKA EAST FORK INDUSTRIAL PARK) BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND ANTICIPATE HOLDING COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING THE ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR FRANK, WEST VIRGINIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AWARD IS THE RESULT OF A PROJECT TRANSFER FROM THE SOMERSET COUNTY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL TO THE REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY OF SOMERSET COUNTY BASED ON SOMERSET COUNTY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL'S REQUEST DATED JULY 20, 2022.  BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM.  FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO DEVELOP SMALLER UNITS OF INDUSTRIAL SPACE - 1,000 TO 25,000 SQUARE FEET FOR GROWING YOUNG COMPANIES THAT ARE NOT READY TO COMMIT TO BUYING/CONSTRUCTING THEIR OWN FACILITY, REMOVE BLIGHTED PROPERTIES AND DEVELOP ENTRY LEVEL HOUSING FOR YOUNGER HOUSEHOLDS. THIS AWARD WILL ALSO SPUR REINVESTMENT IN THE SOMERSET CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT, AND IDENTIFY A LARGE FORMER COAL MINE WITH A COOPERATIVE OWNER AS CANDIDATE FOR ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP, AND REUSE AS A SOLAR FARM. THE RECIPIENT WILL INTERACT WITH LANDOWNERS WHO ARE POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS IN THE PROGRAM AND THOSE WHO BECOME PARTICIPANTS IN THE PROGRAM. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING 15 PHASE I AND 12 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOPING 4 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING 4 PLANNING DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING 13 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS AND BUSINESS OWNERS IN AND NEAR SOMERSET COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (ALSO KNOWN AS THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT, PUBLIC LAW 117-58) FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON, PENNSYLVANIA TO CONDUCT ELIGIBLE ASSESSMENT-RELATED ACTIVITIES AS AUTHORIZED BY CERLCA 104(K)(2) IN COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON, PENNSYLVANIA. BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD ACTIVITIES WILL CONSIST OF SITE-SPECIFIC REMEDIATION AND MONITORING. OUTCOMES:THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 4 LOANS AND 4 SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE BROWNFIELD SITES, HOLD COMMUNITY MEETINGS AS NEEDED, FINALIZE 6 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMIT 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON, PENNSYLVANIA.

DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. ADDITIONALLY, A QUALITY ASSURANCE PLAN WILL BE BE COMPILED ALONG WITH A HEALTH AND SITE SAFETY PLAN.  THE RECIPIENT WILL PRODUCE A CERTIFICATE OF SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETION FROM THE PADEP VCP.    WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR GREENE COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR REGION IV DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION (RIVDA) TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(3) WITHIN THE NINE COUNTIES OF SOUTH-CENTRAL IDAHO THAT INCLUDES BLAINE, CAMAS, CASSIA, ELMORE, GOODING, JEROME, LINCOLN, MINIDOKA, AND TWIN FALLS COUNTIES.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED, AND WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:RIVDA WILL APPROPRIATE $750,000 FOR LOANS/SUBGRANTS. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE AT LEAST 20% OF TOTAL PROJECT COSTS AND MAY APPLY FOR A LOAN/GRANT AWARD UP TO 80% OF TOTAL CLEAN-UP COSTS. OF THE AMOUNT AWARDED, PARTICIPANTS WHO DEMONSTRATE TIMELY PROGRESS OF THE CLEAN-UP WORKPLAN AND ARE ABLE TO MEET PRE-ESTABLISHED BENCHMARKS (JOB CREATION, COMMUNITY GREEN SPACE CREATION), MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR 20% OF THEIR PRINCIPAL LOAN BALANCE TO BE CONVERTED INTO A SUBGRANT. IF BENCHMARKS ARE NOT ACHIEVED UPON THE AGREED DEADLINES, RIVDA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO AWARD THE BORROWER A PARTIAL SUBGRANT BASED ON THEIR ACHIEVEMENTS. IN SOME CASES, THE BORROW MAY NOT BE ELIGIBLE TO HAVE ANY PORTION OF THEIR LOAN CONVERTED INTO A SUBGRANT. OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE 3 BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES ATTENDING 60 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE NINE COUNTIES OF SOUTH-CENTRAL IDAHO THAT INCLUDES BLAINE, CAMAS, CASSIA, ELMORE, GOODING, JEROME, LINCOLN, MINIDOKA, AND TWIN FALLS COUNTIES.

GRANT FUNDS ALSO WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP 25 CLEANUP PLANS AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. THE TARGET AREAS FOR THIS GRANT ARE THE CITY OF PINEVILLE, THE SHREVEPORT COMMON NEIGHBORHOOD IN THE CITY OF SHREVEPORT, THE CITY OF EUNICE'S DOWNTOWN DISTRICT; AND RURAL AND SMALL COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF LOUISIANA. PRIORITY SITES INCLUDE A 618-ACRE HOSPITAL COMPLEX AND CLOSED GAS STATIONS, HISTORIC BUILDINGS, FORMER DRY CLEANERS, AND FORMER INDUSTRIAL SITES THROUGHOUT ALL THREE TARGET AREAS. 

IN ADDITION, LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) WILL WORK WITH LOCAL PARTNERS TO AWARD SUBAWARDS/PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT BROWNFIELDS PLANNING ACTIVITIES TO FACILITATE THE REUSE OF BROWNFIELD PROPERTIES BASED ON COMMUNITY GOALS AND VISION. BROWNFIELD PLANNING ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE: DEVELOPING BROWNFIELD INVENTORIES; CONDUCTING INFRASTRUCTURE ASSESSMENTS; ASSISTING WITH SITE PRIORITIZATION; SITE REUSE PLANNING; AND OTHER PLANNING ACTIVITIES ALLOWED UNDER EPA'S BROWNFIELD PROGRAM. EFFORTS WILL BE MADE TO ESPECIALLY CONNECT WITH ENVIRONMENTAL EQUITY COMMUNITIES AND SUPPORT REDEVELOPMENT OF BROWNFIELD SITES IN OUR TARGET AREAS. LDEQ ESTIMATES CONDUCTING TWO (2) BROWNFIELD PLANNING ACTIVITY INITIATIVES PER YEAR BUT THE EXACT AMOUNT WILL DEPEND ON COMMUNITY INTEREST AND THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR EACH INITIATIVE.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR WESTERN ARKANSAS PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE WESTERN PORTION OF FORT SMITH, ARKANSAS. THE COMMUNITY-WIDE ASSESSMENT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO CONDUCT 15 PHASE I AND UP TO 10 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS. GRANT FUNDS ALSO WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP FIVE CLEANUP OR REUSE PLANS AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. PRIORITY SITES INCLUDE AN 85-ACRE VACANT PROPERTY ALONG THE ARKANSAS RIVER, AND A VACANT AND UNUTILIZED FORMER RETAIL BUILDING IN THE CITY'S HISTORIC DOWNTOWN DISTRICT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR CHICOT COUNTY, ARKANSAS TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE CITIES OF LAKE VILLAGE AND EURDORA. THE LOSS OF THE MISSOURI PACIFIC RAIL LINE TRANSFORMED A SERIES OF ONCE BUSTLING BUSINESSES INTO VACANT BIGHTED WAREHOUSES AND FACTORIES IN LAKE VILLAGE, ALONG THE LINE THROUGH EUDORA, AND FURTHER INTO THE COUNTY. THE PRIMARY GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO IDENTIFY AND QUANTIFY THE ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINATION IN THESE AREAS, IDENTIFY REDEVELOPMENT AND REUSE STRATEGIES, AND ENCOURAGE ECONOMIC REDEVELOPMENT THAT WOULD BENEFIT THE COUNTY. THERE WILL BE NO SUBAWARDS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT. DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,900,000 TO THE CITY OF CHATTANOOGA, TENNESSEE. BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(3); 104(K)(5)(E); 104(K)(10)(B)(III).ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND (RLF) FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUB-GRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE CLEANUPS FOR DEVELOPERS AND RESIDENTS OF CHATTANOOGA, TN.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 5 LOANS AND 5 SUB-GRANTS TO REMEDIATE 5 BROWNFIELD SITES; ANTICIPATES HOLDING 24 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING 5 ANALYSES OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 40 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE ALTON PARK AREA OF CHATTANOOGA, TENNESSEE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE CITY OF ATLANTA, GEORGIA, TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND (RLF) AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(3).  THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,900,000 TO THE CITY OF ATLANTA TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:THE CITY OF ATLANTA WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO CLEANUP AND/OR REMEDIATE FIVE (5) BROWNFIELD SITES USING TWO (2) SUBGRANTS AND THREE (3) LOANS. ONCE THE SITES ARE CLEANED UP AND/OR REMEDIATED, THE SITES WILL BE REDEVELOPED AND/OR REPURPOSED INTO 1) AN 80 ACRE ATLANTA HOUSING AUTHORITY SITE WITH 2000 AFFORDABLE HOUSING UNITS AND ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CENTER; 2) A NEW 20 ACRE RIVERFRONT PARK; 3) REDEVELOPMENT OF A FORMER RAILCAR MANUFACTURING SITE INTO A MIXED USE SITE WITH 500 JOBS; 4) CONSTRUCTION OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING; AND 5) REOPENING OF A 40 ACRE PARK. OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES WORKING IN TARGETED BROWNFIELDS AREAS IN THE CITY OF ATLANTA AND WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO CLEANUP AND/OR REMEDIATE FIVE (5) BROWNFIELD SITES USING SUBGRANTS AND LOANS;  THE RECIPIENT ALSO ANTICIPATES HOLDING TEN (10) (MINIMUM) COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING FIVE (5) ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES (ABCAS)/ CLEANUP PLANS, AND SUBMITTING TWENTY (20) QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN TARGETED BROWNFIELDS AREAS IN AND NEAR THE CITY OF ATLANTA, GEORGIA. TARGETED BROWNFIELDS AREAS INCLUDE GROUNDWORK ATLANTA CHATTAHOOCHEE RIVERFRONT; PROCTOR CREEK WATERSHED, SOUTHWEST ATLANTA AREA WIDE PLAN, ATLANTA BELTLINE, AND TARGETED AREA REDEVELOPMENT CORRIDORS/PRIORITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AREAS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDEVELOPMENT OF AN 80 ACRE ATLANTA HOUSING AUTHORITY SITE WITH 2000 AFFORDABLE HOUSING UNITS AND ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CENTER; A NEW 20 ACRE RIVERFRONT PARK; REDEVELOPMENT OF A FORMER RAILCAR MANUFACTURING SITE INTO A MIXED USE SITE WITH AND ESTIMATED 500 JOBS; CONSTRUCTION OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING; AND THE REOPENING OF A 40 ACRE PARK. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE COMMUNITIES WHERE JOBS ARE NEEDED AND ADDITIONAL AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND ACCESS TO PARKS AND GREENSPACE ARE NEEDED FOR SUSTAINABLE ECONOMIC EQUITY AND IMPROVED HEALTH.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000,000  FOR THE PIEDMONT TRIAD REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(3) THAT WILL IN TURN BE AVAILABLE FOR CLEANUP PROJECTS WITHIN THE JURISDICTIONS OF (A) PIEDMONT TRIAD, (B) THE TRIANGLE J COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NORTH CAROLINA), AND THE WEST PIEDMONT PLANNING DISTRICT (VIRGINIA). BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT.  ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED, AND WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:THE PROJECT SCOPE INCLUDES MAKING LOANS AND SUB-GRANTS THAT WILL BE USED FOR ENVIRONMENTAL CLEANUP PROJECTS. THE ESTIMATED SUBAWARD BUDGET IS $1,075,000 TOTAL, OF WHICH $200,000 WILL BE MET VIA THE REQUIRED COST-SHARE. OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 3 LOANS AND 1 OR MORE SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE 3 BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING 10 COMMITTEE COMMUNITY MEETINGS, AND SUBMITTING 19 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE COUNTIES UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF PIEDMONT TRIAD REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (NORTH CAROLINA), THE TRIANGLE J COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NORTH CAROLINA), AND THE WEST PIEDMONT PLANNING DISTRICT (VIRGINIA).

DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000,000 TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND (RLF) AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(3) IN THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED, AND WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO MAKE LOANS AND SUB-GRANTS TO PERFORM SITE CLEANUP. LOANS THAT ARE RE-PAID TO MDEQ WILL GENERATE PROGRAM INCOME, WHICH WILL BE SUBJECT TO SECTION IV OF THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, AS WELL AS THE CLOSEOUT AGREEMENT FOR THIS GRANT. OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 4 LOANS TO REMEDIATE 4 BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING 8 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING 4 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 19 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI.

ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING 12 PHASE I AND 6 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING 5 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOPING 6 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING 6 PLANNING DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING 16 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND BROWNFIELD IN AND NEAR SAVANNAH, GEORGIA.

EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING SEVEN (7) PHASE I AND SIX (6) PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING EIGHT (8) COMMUNITY MEETINGS, AND DEVELOPING FIVE (5) SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES  TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING SIXTEEN (16) QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL  BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR MERRITT ISLAND, FLORIDA.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE CITY OF ROCKFORD TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(5)(A)(II) IN THE CITY OF ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS.ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE RECIPIENT WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE GRANTED TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES FOR THE REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELDS SITES.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 5 LOANS AND 1 SUBGRANT TO REMEDIATE 6 BROWNFIELD SITES; ANTICIPATES HOLDING 12 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING 6 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE EASTERN INDUSTRIAL CORRIDOR OF THE CITY OF WEST ALLIS, WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR NORTHEAST OHIO AREAWIDE COORDINATING AGENCY (NOACA) TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(3) IN ASHTABULA, CUYAHOGA, GEAUGA, LAKE, LORAIN, MAHONING, MEDINA, PORTAGE, STARK, SUMMIT, TRUMBULL, AND WAYNE COUNTIES, OHIO.  ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED, AND WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT FOR THE REMEDIATION OF ELIGIBLE BROWNFIELDS SITES.OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE LOANS SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE BROWNFIELD SITES.  THE NUMBER OF LOANS AND SUBGRANTS WILL DEPEND UPON THE DOLLAR AMOUNT OF THE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS.  AT LEAST 50% OF THE GRANT FUNDING AND ASSOCIATED COST SHARE WILL BE USED FOR LOANS AND ASSOCIATED ELIGIBLE PROGRAMMATIC COSTS.  THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES HOLDING COMMUNITY MEETINGS FOR EACH LOAN AND SUBGRANT.  THEY WILL FINALIZE AN ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES FOR EACH LOAN AND SUBGRANT AND WILL SUBMIT 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR ASHTABULA, CUYAHOGA, GEAUGA, LAKE, LORAIN, MAHONING, MEDINA, PORTAGE, STARK, SUMMIT, TRUMBULL, AND WAYNE COUNTIES, OHIO.

DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF MENASHA TO CONDUCT ELIGIBLE ASSESSMENT-RELATED ACTIVITIES AS AUTHORIZED BY CERLCA 104(K)(2) IN MENASHA, WI.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE CITY WAS AWARDED A $500,000 U.S. EPA CWA GRANT TO ADDRESS SITES CONTAMINATED BY HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES AND/OR PETROLEUM PRODUCTS. THE FOCUS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE ON THE ASSESSMENT AND REUSE PLANNING OF HIGH PRIORITY BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGHOUT THE CITY WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS ON PRIORITY SITES WITHIN THE TARGET AREAS (IE., FORMER BANTA /GILBERT MILL, FORMER WHITING MILL, GUNDERSON CLEANERS/MARINA, AND JEFFERSON PARK). CONCENTRATING ON THESE PRIORITY SITES WILL HELP THE CITY ACHIEVE ITS PLANNED OUTCOMES FOR THE TARGET AREAS. PRIORITY SITES AND ADJACENT NEIGHBORHOODS WHICH INCLUDE SPARKING REINVESTMENT IN UNDERUTILIZED PARCELS/BUILDINGS, EXPANDING/DIVERSIFYING HOUSING OPTIONS, PROMOTING ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE, ENHANCING ECONOMIC COMPETITIVENESS, INCREASING CONNECTIVITY AND ENHANCING GREENSPACES, AND SPURRING ECONOMIC GROWTH. THE CITY RECOGNIZES THAT ASSESSMENT OF THE PRIORITY SITES AND OTHER BROWNFIELDS WITHIN THE CITY IS A CRUCIAL COMPONENT TO MEET THE IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY FOR EACH AREA AND TO ENSURE THE GRANTS ARE SUCCESSFULLY UTILIZED. PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO BROWNFIELD SITES WITH VIABLE REDEVELOPMENT PLANS WHERE ASSESSMENT IS LIKELY TO SPUR FUTURE PRIVATE INVESTMENT, OR TO SITES THAT POSE THE GREATEST RISK OF ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT TO SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS.

THE PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PLAN (CEP) WHICH WILL OUTLINE COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIONS FOCUSED IN THE TARGET AREAS, ADJACENT NEIGHBORHOODS, AND REMAINING RESIDENTS THROUGHOUT THE CITY. THE OUTREACH PROGRAM WILL INCLUDE PUBLIC MEETINGS AND FORUMS, DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF MARKETING AND INFORMATIONAL MATERIALS, AND JOINT OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS.

WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR MENASHA, WI.   MENASHA ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING A BROWNFIELDS INVENTORY, CONDUCTING 12 PHASE 1 SITE INVESTIGATIONS, 12 PHASE 2 SITE INVESTIGATIONS, AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS.

4.1 TASK 1 - COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT OVERSIGHT, REPORTING, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH
I. IMPLEMENTATION: REPORTING ACTIVITIES TO BE COMPLETED UNDER THIS TASK INCLUDE: 1) QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTING, 2) ANNUAL DISADVANTAGED BUSINESS ENTERPRISE (DBE) REPORTING, 3) PROPERTY PROFILE FORM SUBMISSION AND UPDATES IN THE ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES), 4) PREPARATION OF A FINAL REPORT, AND 5) EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH GRANTEE ATTENDANCE AT 2 BROWNFIELD CONFERENCES.
OUTREACH ACTIVITIES TO BE COMPLETED UNDER THIS TASK INCLUDE: 1) COMPLETION OF AN UPDATE TO THE EXISTING COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN (CIP) FOR THE FY2018 GRANT; 2) ORGANIZING AND HOSTING UP TO 9 MEETINGS OF THE BAC; 3) HOSTING UP TO 6 PUBLIC OUTREACH MEETINGS IN THE TARGET AREA NEIGHBORHOODS; 4) CONDUCTING MEETINGS WITH INDIVIDUAL PROPERTY OWNERS, AS APPROPRIATE; 5) FACT SHEET AND PRESS RELEASE PREPARATION; AND 6) REGULAR UPDATES TO THE EXISTING BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM WEBPAGE.
II. ANTICIPATED SCHEDULE: IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT A CONTRACT WILL BE EXECUTED WITH A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL (QEP) PRIOR TO THE ANTICIPATED 10/1/2022 PROJECT START DATE. QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS (QPRS) WILL BE SUBMITTED BY JANUARY 30TH, APRIL 30TH, JULY 30TH, AND OCTOBER 30TH OF EACH YEAR. ANNUAL DBE REPORTS WILL BE SUBMITTED BY OCTOBER 30TH OF EACH YEAR. INITIAL INFORMATION ON SITES WILL BE ENTERED INTO ACRES AS ELIGIBILITY IS CONFIRMED AND UPDATED UPON COMPLETION OF KEY OUTPUTS OR OTHER MILESTONES.
AN UPDATE TO THE CIP WILL BE COMPLETED PRIOR TO 10/1/2022. BAC MEETINGS WILL BE HELD APPROXIMATELY EVERY 4 MONTHS. OTHER OUTREACH MEETINGS WILL OCCUR AS NEEDED TO FACILITATE ACTIVITIES AT INDIVIDUAL PRIORITY SITES. UPDATES TO THE WEBPAGE WILL BE COMPLETED AS NEEDED (BUT AT LEAST QUARTERLY). UPDATES ON PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO BE INCLUDED IN OUR QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER WHICH IS SENT BY MAIL TO 163 HOUSEHOLDS AND EMAIL TO GT;400 ACTIVE SUBSCRIBERS.
III. TASK/ACTIVITY LEAD: PRAIRIE HILLS PROJECT MANAGER (DAVID KING) WILL LEAD THIS TASK AND BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COMPLETING GRANT-ELIGIBLE PROGRAMMATIC AND ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS UNDER THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (CA), AS WELL AS PARTICIPATE IN AND HELP COORDINATE ALL OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE WASHINGTON COUNTY COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AGENCY TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE CITY OF FOREST LAKE, CITY OF ST. PAUL PARK, AND CITY OF NEWPORT, MINNESOTA. GRANT FUNDING WILL BE INITIALLY ALLOCATED TO THE IDENTIFIED TARGET AREAS OF DOWNTOWN FOREST LAKE, THE CITY OF ST. PAUL PARK AND US 61 WESTERN FRONTAGE ROADS IN NEWPORT. THESE TARGET AREAS ARE A MIX OF RESIDENTIAL/COMMERCIAL/INDUSTRIAL NEIGHBORHOODS DATING BACK 100+ YEARS THAT HAVE BEEN SUBJECT TO RECENT ECONOMIC AND PLANNING EFFORTS. EACH TARGET AREA HAS BROWNFIELDS LOCATED WITHIN AND ADJACENT TO RESIDENTIAL AREAS THAT HAVE SIGNIFICANT MINORITY, SENSITIVE, AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED POPULATION GROUPS. BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THE PURPOSE OF THE BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT COALITION GRANT IS FOR THREE OR MORE ELIGIBLE ENTITIES TO WORK TOGETHER ON A MINIMUM OF FIVE HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE AND/OR PETROLEUM SITES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVENTORY AND SITE PRIORITIZATION, PHASE I ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS (ESAS), PHASE II ESAS, REMEDIAL ACTION PLAN (RAP), AND REMEDIAL/REUSE PLANNING, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND INVOLVEMENT. DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE: GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS) DATA ENTRY AND MAPPING, DOCUMENTS SUCH AS ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS AND PROPERTY ACCESS AGREEMENTS, QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP), QUARTERLY AND FINAL REPORTS, OUTREACH DOCUMENTS, ETC. THIS PROJECT AND ALL THE ACTIVITIES RELATED TO IT WILL ULTIMATELY BENEFIT THE PEOPLE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY, MN.

IN ADDITION, FOCUS ON TARGET AREA SITES WITHIN THE EAST MAIN STREET AND EAST FAIRCHILD CORRIDORS. THE GOAL OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO UNDERSTAND THE NATURE OF CONTAMINATION AT BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGHOUT THE CITY MUNICIPALITIES AND FACILITATE THEIR CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF INDIANAPOLIS, INDIANA TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE ENTIRE CITY, WITH A FOCUS ON THE INDY EAST PROMISE ZONE. ASSESSMENTS WILL ALSO BE PRIORITIZED FOR THE GEOGRAPHY OF THE RECENT AREA WIDE PLANNING GRANT, LOCATED WITHIN THE IEPZ. BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT OR CONTAMINANT.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO BLUGOLD REAL STATE FOUNDATION, INC TO IMPLEMENT HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CLEANUP ACTIVITIES AT TWO ADJACENT PROPERTIES (1111 AND 1061 MENOMINEE STREET), EAU CLAIRE, WI.  TWO CLEANUP PROPOSALS WERE AWARDED AND HAVE BEEN COMBINED INTO ONE AWARD BECAUSE BOTH ARE PART OF THE SAME OVERARCHING DEVELOPMENT PLAN, THE ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR IN TANDEM AND ARE ADDRESSED IN ONE WORKPLAN.  THE 2 HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CLEANUP GRANTS WILL BE USED TO CLEANUP AND ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINATION RESULTING FROM OVER 100 YEARS OF INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITIES.  EPA FUNDS WILL HELP TO PREPARE THE SITE FOR REDEVELOPMENT AS THE SONNENTAG EVENT CENTER AND RECREATIONAL COMPLEX.  THIS FUTURE DEVELOPMENT, A COLLABORATION BETWEEN MULTIPLE PARTNERS, WILL NOT ONLY SERVE THE UNIVERSITY, BUT THE CITY OF EAU CLAIRE AND A REGIONAL POPULATION OF NEARLY 330,000 PEOPLE.  CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT WILL SUPPORT THE CITY OF EAUCLAIRE'S PRIORITY REDEVELOPMENT AREAS ALONG THE CHIPPEWA RI

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF GREEN BAY TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR BROWNFIELDS SITES IN THE CITY OF GREEN BAY, WISCONSIN.  THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE ASSESSMENT OF BROWNFIELD PROPERTIES, INCLUDING PHASE I AND II ESAS AND SURVEYS FOR ASBESTOS OR OTHER HAZARDOUS MATERIALS. THE FOCUS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE ON THE ASSESSMENT AND REUSE PLANNING OF HIGH PRIORITY BROWNFIELD SITES ALONG THE TARGET AREAS OF THE BROADWAY, UNIVERSITY AVENUE, AND VELP AVENUE CORRIDORS. FOCUSING ON THESE TARGET AREAS WILL CURB THE SUCCESS OF THE PREVIOUS AWP EFFORTS (DESCRIBED ABOVE) WHERE EPA FUNDS HAVE ALREADY BEEN INVESTED. THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF MANKATO, MINNESOTA TO BE USED TO CONDUCT COMMUNITY-WIDE ASSESSMENTS AT POTENTIAL BROWNFIELD SITES CONTAMINATED WITH PETROLEUM AND/OR HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES.  THE GRANT RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT SITE PRIORITIZATION, AND WILL FOCUS IN THE TARGET AREA WHICH INCLUDES THE COMMERCIAL/INDUSTRIAL/RESIDENTIAL AREAS ALONG THE RIVER OF THE DOWNTOWN, OLD TOWN AND SIBLEY PARK NEIGHBORHOODS. THE PORT AUTHORITY WILL FOCUS ITS REDEVELOPMENT EFFORTS ON PORTSMOUTH, OHIO, SPECIFICALLY ON THE OF REVITALIZATION PORTSMOUTH'S OLDEST AND MOST DENSELY POPULATION INDUSTRIAL AREA, THE CENTRAL OHIO RIVER TERMINAL CORRIDOR (CORTC). DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) FOR CITY OF NEW LONDON TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(3) IN NEW LONDON, CONNECTICUT.  ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED, AND WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SITE-SPECIFIC AND NON-SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDED: NON-SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE, MARKETING THE PROGRAM TO CITIES, TOWNS, DEVELOPERS, AND NON-PROFITS, CONDUCTING PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND PREPARING OUTREACH MATERIALS RELEVANT TO THE CITY OF NEW LONDON'S RLF PROGRAM. SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE VERIFYING SITE AND BORROWER/SUBGRANT ELIGIBILITY, SUB-GRANT AGREEMENTS, CONDUCTING SITE-SPECIFIC PUBLIC RELATIONS ACTIVITIES, AND CONSULTING WITH AND ENROLLING SITES IN THE CONNECTICUT VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM. THE CITY OF NEW LONDON WILL OVERSEE COMPLETION OF SITE REMEDIATION AND PREPARATION OF CLEANUP COMPLETION DOCUMENTATION, INCLUDING IMPLEMENTATION OF INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS.OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 10 LOANS AND 10 SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE UP TO 20 BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING UP TO 25 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING UP TO 20 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING UP TO 25 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR NEW LONDON, CONNECTICUT.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR TOWN OF KILLINGLY TO CONDUCT ELIGIBLE PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(4) IN THE TOWN OF KILLINGLY, CONNECTICUT. 

ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO PLAN, INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES, AND REMEDIATE SITES. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE TOWN OF KILLINGLY, CONNECTICUT.

ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE VERIFYING SITE AND BORROWER/SUBGRANT ELIGIBILITY, SUB-GRANT AGREEMENTS, CONDUCTING SITE-SPECIFIC PUBLIC RELATIONS ACTIVITIES, AND CONSULTING WITH AND ENROLLING SITES IN THE VERMONT VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR THE WITHIN THEIR JURISDICTION IN SOUTHEASTERN VERMONT.

THIS PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO TOWN OF ST. JOHNSBURY, VERMONT  TO CLEAN UP A BROWNFIELD SITE, THE ST. JOHNSBURY ARMORY,  ST. JOHNSBURY, VERMONT.  BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THE ARMORY IS CENTRAL FOCUS AND ANCHOR OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT FOR THE MAIN STREET CORRIDOR. THE ARMORY BUILDING IS CONTAMINATED AND STRUCTURALLY COMPROMISED, WHICH HAS CAUSED DEVELOPERS TO DEEM THE PROJECT UNFEASIBLE IN THE PAST. THE VACANT BUILDING HAS NO UTILITY UNTIL PROPERLY REMEDIATED.  

AN ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES (ABCA) WAS PREPARED FOR THE SITE AND PROVIDES AN EVALUATION OF ABATEMENT OPTIONS AND COSTS FOR REGULATED BUILDING MATERIALS (RBMS) IDENTIFIED TO DATE. THE ABCA IDENTIFIED FULL REMOVAL OF ASBESTOS-CONTAINING MATERIALS (ACM) THROUGHOUT THE BUILDING, ABATEMENT OF POLYCHLORINATED BIPHENYL (PCB) CONTAINING FLOOR PAINT IN THE BASEMENT AND REMOVAL OF LEAD-BASED PAINT (LBP) WHERE APPLICABLE. A CERTIFIED ASBESTOS AND LBP ABATEMENT CONTRACTOR WILL BE PROCURED BY THE TOWN TO IMPLEMENT CLEANUP WHICH INCLUDES COMPLETE ABATEMENT AND OFF-SITE DISPOSAL OF ALL IDENTIFIED ACM AND PCBS. CLEANUP WILL ALSO INCLUDE THE ENCAPSULATION OF IDENTIFIED LBP.  CONFIRMATION SAMPLING WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED. 

DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE 1) COMMUNITY OUTREACH INCLUDING DRAFTING A COMMUNITY RELATIONS PLAN, ESTABLISHING AN INFORMATION REPOSITORY, CONDUCTING PUBLIC MEETINGS ON CLEAN UP ACTIVITIES WITH THE OUTCOME TO IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING OF HOW CLEAN UP ALTERNATIVES WERE SELECTED AND WILL BE IMPLEMENTED FOR THE GREATER ST. JOHNSBURY COMMUNITY AND 2) CLEANUP PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION INCLUDING KICK-OFF MEETING WITH STATE, EPA, LOCAL OFFICIALS AND THE SELECTED CONTRACTOR(S), ENSURING HISTORIC PRESERVATION REQUIREMENTS ARE MET, PREPARATION OF THE CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN (CAP), PREPARING DECISION DOCUMENTS AS A RESULT OF PUBLIC INPUT, DEVELOPING A SITE SPECIFIC QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN  AND PREPARATION OF REMEDIAL DESIGN AND ENGINEERING DOCUMENTS WITH THE OUTCOME OF A CLEANUP CONDUCTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH STATE AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS, PUBLIC INPUT AND DOCUMENTED CONFIRMATORY SAMPLING FOR THE GREATER ST. JOHNSBURY COMMUNITY AND CLEANUP PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION.  

CLEANUP OF HAZARDOUS BUILDING MATERIALS IS REQUIRED NOT ONLY TO INITIATE REVITALIZATION OF THE ARMORY, BUT ALSO TO PROTECT THE HEALTH OF NEARBY RESIDENTS AND VISITORS. THIS WOULD ALSO PROVIDE A CATALYST FOR RENOVATION OF THE BUILDING WHICH WOULD ELIMINATE PHYSICAL HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH LOCAL YOUTHS AND THE HOMELESS POPULATION THAT HAVE BEEN BREAKING AND ENTERING THE STRUCTURE DESPITE THE EFFORTS UNDERTAKEN BY THE TOWN TO SECURE THE PROPERTY. THE OVERALL REUSE STRATEGY FOR THE ARMORY IS TO CREATE A NEW LOCATION FOR THE ST. JOHNSBURY POLICE AND DISPATCH CENTER WHICH HAVE OUTGROWN THEIR CURRENT SPACE IN A BUILDING THAT NO LONGER SUITS THEIR OPERATIONAL NEEDS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD: N/A &NDASHAND NO SUBAWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED.

WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND BROWNFIELD IN AND NEAR DERRY AND MANCHESTER, NEW HAMPSHIRE.

ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RECIPIENT TO INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, AND CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING 15 PHASE I AND 10 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING 15 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOPING 6 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING 6 PLANNING DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING 16 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND BROWNFIELD IN AND NEAR HANCOCK, PENOBSCOT, PISCATAQUIS, AND WALDO COUNTIES,  MAINE.

BROWNFIELDS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY, BUT WE BELIEVE DIRECTING OUR ATTENTION TO THE DOWNTOWNS, WATERFRONTS, AND ECONOMIC CENTERS OF THESE COMMUNITIES WILL HAVE THE STRONGEST POSITIVE EFFECT ON THESE AREAS WITH THE GREATEST NEED FOR CONTINUED SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT.  OUR PROJECT GOALS ARE TO ASSESS PROPERTIES THAT POSE A POTENTIAL HAZARD TO SENSITIVE RECEPTORS AND TO TARGET DEVELOPERS WHO CAN PROVIDE REDEVELOPMENT FOCUSED ON TECHNOLOGY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING, AND YEAR-ROUND EMPLOYMENT, WHICH COINCIDES WITH OUR STRATEGIC PLANS.**CUSTOMIZE BASED ON INFORMATION IN THE APPLICATION/WORKPLAN.
