ADDITIONALLY, KENNEBEC VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. KENNEBEC VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES)SUBRECIPIENT:KENNEBEC VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENT WILL PROVIDE SUBGRANTS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES TO REMEDIATE CONTAMINATION AND PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL, SOCIAL AND HEALTH BENEFITS TO THE CITIZENS OF KENNEBEC, SOMERSET, AND WESTERN WALDO COUNTIES.  SPECIFIC AND NON SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES AND TASKS INCLUDE: 

-	CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF THE PROGRAM AND PROVIDING OVERSIGHT, MARKETING THE PROGRAM, AND ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY;
-	PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO ELIGIBLE SITES BY SUBGRANTS; AND
-	PROVIDING OVERSIGHT OF SITE CLEANUPS AND ASSISTANCE ENROLLING IN THE STATE OF MAINE'S VOLUNTARY RESPONSE ACTION PROGRAM (VRAP).OUTCOMES:KENNEBEC VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY THREE (3) LOANS AND ONE (1) SUBGRANT TO REMEDIATE FOUR (4) BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING FOUR (4) COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING FOUR (4) ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING EIGHT (8) QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN THE CENTRAL MAINE COUNTIES OF KENNEBEC, SOMERSET, AND SIX MUNICIPALITIES IN WESTERN WALDO COUNTY (BURNHAM, UNITY, TROY, THORNDIKE, PALERMO AND FREEDOM, MAINE.

ADDITIONALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES, AND WILL REPORT ON INTERIM PROGRESS AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE CITY WILL USE THIS FUNDING TO: MAINTAIN COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT-RELATED FILES; RECONSTITUTE THE CITY'S EXISTING BROWNFIELDS SELECTION COMMITTEE; ATTEND AND/OR PARTICIPATE IN CONFERENCES, TRAININGS, COURSES, AND WORKSHOPS; OBTAIN QUALIFIED PROFESSIONAL SERVICES; REVIEW AND/OR UPDATE SITE SELECTION PROCEDURES; CREATE AND SUBMIT REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENTS; CONDUCT REPORTING; CONFIRM COMMITMENTS MADE BY LOCAL COMMUNITY PARTNERS IN THE ORIGINAL GRANT APPLICATION; PROVIDE INDIVIDUAL CONFIDENTIAL RESPONSES TO QUESTIONS AND/OR CONCERNS POSED BY RESIDENTS, CURRENT PROPERTY OWNERS, PROSPECTIVE PROPERTY PURCHASERS, AND/OR PROSPECTIVE DEVELOPERS; UPDATE EXISTING AND DEVELOP NEW COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT DELIVERABLES; UPDATE THE CITY'S EXISTING INVENTORY OF POTENTIAL BROWNFIELDS;

 FURTHER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES CONDUCTING TWO PHASE 1 UPDATES, EIGHT PHASE I AND 10 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, HOLDING EIGHT COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOPING 10 SITE-SPECIFIC CLEANUP PLANS/ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, DEVELOPING TWO PLANNING  DOCUMENTS TO INITIATE BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION, AND SUBMITTING 16 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN THE CITY OF BELFAST, MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE ANDROSCOGGIN VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(5)(A)(II) IN COMMUNITIES ALONG THE ANDROSCOGGIN RIVER AND ON MAJOR TRANSPORTATION CORRIDORS WHICH ARE SERVICE CENTERS TO THE RURAL WESTERN MAINE REGION. THIS CORRIDOR OF COMMUNITIES INCLUDES LEWISTON AND AUBURN AS THE URBAN CENTER AND COMMUNITIES OF RUMFORD AND WILTON MAINE.ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR AVCOG TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, AVCOG WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. AVCOG WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:SITE-SPECIFIC AND NON-SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDED: NON-SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE, MARKETING THE PROGRAM TO CITIES, TOWNS, DEVELOPERS, AND NON-PROFITS, CONDUCTING PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND PREPARING OUTREACH MATERIALS RELEVANT TO THE AVCOG RLF PROGRAM. SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE VERIFYING SITE AND BORROWER/SUBGRANT ELIGIBILITY, SUB-GRANT AGREEMENTS, CONDUCTING SITE-SPECIFIC PUBLIC RELATIONS ACTIVITIES, AND CONSULTING WITH AND ENROLLING SITES IN THE MAINE VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM. AVCOG WILL OVERSEE COMPLETION OF SITE REMEDIATION AND PREPARATION OF CLEANUP COMPLETION DOCUMENTATION, INCLUDING IMPLEMENTATION OF INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL ISSUE APPROXIMATELY 3 LOANS AND 3 SUBGRANTS TO REMEDIATE 6 BROWNFIELD SITE(S); ANTICIPATES HOLDING 6 COMMUNITY MEETINGS, FINALIZING 6 ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVES, AND SUBMITTING 20 QUARTERLY REPORTS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS OWNERS, AND STAKEHOLDERS IN AND NEAR ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY, MAINE.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE NAUGATUCK VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(5)(A)(II) IN THE NAUGATUCK VALLEY REGION OF CONNECTICUT. ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE NAUGATUCK VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS TO RE-CAPITALIZE A REVOLVING LOAN FUND FROM WHICH TO MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO CLEAN UP BROWNFIELD SITE(S) AND CONDUCT OTHER NECESSARY ACTIVITIES TO PRUDENTLY MANAGE THE RLF. ADDITIONALLY, THE NAUGATUCK VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS WILL COMPETITIVELY PROCURE (AS NEEDED) AND DIRECT A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL TO OVERSEE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ACTIVITIES AND WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD FOR EACH SITE THAT IS REMEDIATED. THE NAUGATUCK VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS WILL REPORT ON PROGRAM INCOME, INTERIM PROGRESS, AND FINAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY COMPLETING AND SUBMITTING RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE PROPERTY PROFILE FORM AND BROWNFIELDS RLF FORM USING EPA'S ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT EXCHANGE SYSTEM (ACRES). SUBRECIPIENT:THE GOAL OF THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED BY THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CAPITALIZE THE REVOLVING LOAN FUND AND MAKE LOANS AND SUBGRANTS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES FOR CLEANUP OF SITES IN ORDER TO FACILITATE THE PROPERTIES' REDEVELOPMENT. THESE GOALS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY SITE-SPECIFIC AND NON-SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES. NON-SITE-SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE DEVELOPING THE LOAN PROGRAM, MARKETING THE PROGRAM TO CITIES, TOWNS, DEVELOPERS, ETC., OBTAINING CONTRACTOR SERVICES TO PROVIDE A QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL (QEP), AND CONDUCTING PUBLIC OUTREACH AND PREPARING OUTREACH MATERIALS RELEVANT TO THE RLF PROGRAM.
